meanings.sent1: She miscoded the program and it crashed.
meanings.sent2: He always double-checks to make sure he doesn't miscoded the data.
meanings.sent3: The robot miscoded the commands and started dancing instead of cleaning.
meanings.sent4: Her brain seemed to miscoded the signals, making her trip over her own feet.
meanings.sent5: The consequences of miscoding can be costly and time-consuming.

meanings.definition: To assign an incorrect code to something.
meanings.sent1: The cashier miscoded the item, causing confusion at the checkout.
meanings.sent2: Make sure you don't miscoded the products when labeling them for shipping.
meanings.sent3: The student miscoded the answers on the test, turning a pass into a fail.
meanings.sent4: His mind seemed to miscoded the prices, always getting them wrong at the store.
meanings.sent5: Miscoding can lead to misunderstandings and errors in the system.
